info.title: Email Intelligence API
info.description: Email Inelligence API provides fast, deterministic scoring and validation for both email addresses and personal names. It analyzes full email quality, detects disposable or risky domains, identifies role-based and free-provider emails, evaluates name structure, flags profanity, and assigns fraud-risk scores. Ideal for signup forms, lead validation, fraud prevention, and marketing automation. Fully stateless, privacy-friendly, and built for high-volume production use.

get.description: Lightweight health endpoint returning API status and uptime. Designed for monitoring, load balancers, and service checks to verify availability of the Email Intelligence REST API.

post.summary: Real-time Email Validation — Syntax, MX, disposable detection & role-based checks
post.description: Real-time email validation: syntax, MX/DNS checks, disposable and free-provider detection, role-account flags, and a clear risk reason. Ideal for signup quality, deliverability optimization, fraud prevention, and automated data-cleaning workflows.

post.summary: Email Risk Scoring — Fraud & deliverability score (0–100)
post.description: Lightweight scoring endpoint ideal for ranking, gating, triage, or routing workflows where speed is critical.Returns an overall email quality and fraud-risk score with a human-readable label. Combines domain reputation, disposability, syntax and pattern signals for gating, routing, and prioritization in fraud prevention, onboarding, and marketing pipelines.

post.summary: Bulk Email Validation & Scoring — High-volume deliverability checks, disposable detection, and risk scoring (up to 5,000 emails)
post.description:
Processes up to 5,000 email addresses in a single request using the complete validation and scoring engine. Each email is analyzed for syntax correctness, MX/DNS health, disposable or temporary domains, free-provider identification, role-based accounts, profanity indicators, structural anomalies, and an overall risk/quality score with clear reason codes.

Ideal for lead verification, signup quality control, fraud prevention, email list cleaning, and deliverability optimization. Fully stateless, privacy-friendly, and optimized for parallel batch processing. Results are returned in the same order as the input array. The bulk endpoint is optimized for fast, stateless parallel processing and can handle thousands of emails efficiently in pipelines or worker queues.

post.summary: Name Validation & Fake Detection — Authenticity and quality scoring
post.description: Evaluate personal names for realism and quality: profanity, random tokens, repetition, and token-pattern issues. Provides validity flag, fake-likelihood (0–1), numeric confidence score, and actionable issue list for signup hygiene and identity verification. Uses deterministic heuristics (no ML, no storage) for consistent and privacy-safe name quality scoring.

emails.title: Emails
emails.description: A list of email addresses to analyze and validate in bulk. This endpoint is optimized for high-volume batch processing and is ideal for email list cleaning, signup quality filtering, fraud prevention, and deliverability optimization. Each email is evaluated using full quality-scoring logic including syntax validation, MX checks, disposable domain detection, free vs paid provider identification, role-based analysis, profanity screening, and anomaly detection. Order of results matches input order for easy correlation.

results.title: Bulk Email Validation Results
results.description: Detailed validation output for each email address submitted in the bulk request. Each entry includes syntax analysis, MX record checks, disposable domain detection, role-based identification, free-provider detection, profanity screening, structural anomaly checks, and a normalized risk score with human-readable reason codes. Results are returned in the same order as the input list.

count.title: Processed Count
count.description: The total number of email addresses successfully processed in this bulk request. This value always matches the length of the `"results"` array.

risk_score.title: Risk Score
risk_score.description: Calculated risk score (0 low — 100 high) based on combined email risk factors to support decisioning and workflows.

label.title: Label
label.description: Readable category for the score such as `valid_email`, `medium_risk`, `high_risk`, `invalid_format`, or `unknown` — great for UI badges and logs.

email.title: Email
email.description: Enter the email address to analyze and validate — ideal for improving deliverability, reducing fraud, and cleaning user data.

email.title: Email
email.description: Normalized, lowercase email address returned after validation — ready for safe storage and reliable comparisons.

valid_syntax.title: Valid Syntax
valid_syntax.description: Confirms the address matches standard email format (RFC-compliant) — the first line of defense against malformed input.

has_mx.title: Has Mx
has_mx.description: Checks for Mail Exchange (MX) DNS records for the domain to assess deliverability and legitimacy — missing MX is a strong signal of non‑receiving domains.

disposable.title: Disposable
disposable.description: Flags domains known to provide temporary or disposable inboxes — helps prevent throwaway accounts and abuse.

role_based.title: Role Based
role_based.description: Detects generic role accounts (e.g., admin, support, no-reply) which often indicate lower engagement or system addresses.

free_provider.title: Free Provider
free_provider.description: Identifies common consumer free email providers (Gmail, Yahoo, Outlook) to help with segmentation and risk profiling.

risk_score.title: Risk Score
risk_score.description: Aggregate risk score from 0 (low) to 100 (high) derived from validation checks — use for gating, prioritization, or automated workflows.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Human-readable label explaining the primary conclusion (e.g., `valid_email`, `medium_risk`, `high_risk`, `invalid_format`) for easy reporting and UI messaging.

name.title: Name
name.description: Full name to validate — use for improving user data quality, identity checks, and fraud detection.

valid.title: Valid
valid.description: Indicates whether the provided name passes heuristic and quality checks — useful for signup validation and risk assessment.

fake_likelihood.title: Fake Likelihood
fake_likelihood.description: Probability from 0.0 to 1.0 that the name is synthetic or unlikely to be real — integrate into fraud scoring or review workflows.

score.title: Score
score.description: Name quality score (0–100) where higher values indicate stronger confidence the name is genuine.

issues.title: Issues
issues.description: List of detected issues (e.g., `contains_numbers`, `contains_symbols`, `too_short`, `too_long`, `repetitive`, `offensive`, `single_token_short`) to provide actionable feedback or enforce policies.
